com.zhuinden.simplestack

Class BackstackManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.zhuinden.simplestack.BackstackManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Bundleable

    public class BackstackManager
extends java.lang.Object
implements Bundleable
    The backstack manager manages a Backstack internally, and wraps it with the ability of persisting view state and the backstack history itself. The backstack is created by setup(List), and initialized by setStateChanger(StateChanger).

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  BackstackManager.StateClearStrategy
      Specifies the strategy to be used in order to delete SavedStates that are no longer needed after a StateChange, when there is no pending StateChange left.

      BackstackManager()

      Restores the state of the view based on the currently stored SavedState, according to the view's key.

      Setup creates the Backstack with the specified initial keys.
      StateBundle toBundle()

      • BackstackManager

        public BackstackManager()

    • Method Detail

      • setKeyParceler

        public void setKeyParceler(KeyParceler keyParceler)
        Specifies a custom KeyParceler, allowing key parcellation strategies to be used for turning a key into Parcelable. If used, this method must be called before setup(List) .
        Parameters:
        keyParceler - The custom KeyParceler.

      • setStateClearStrategy

        public void setStateClearStrategy(BackstackManager.StateClearStrategy stateClearStrategy)
        Specifies a custom BackstackManager.StateClearStrategy, allowing a custom strategy for clearing the retained state of keys. The DefaultStateClearStrategy clears the SavedState for keys that are not found in the new state. If used, this method must be called before setup(List) .
        Parameters:
        stateClearStrategy - The custom BackstackManager.StateClearStrategy.

      • setup

        public void setup(@NonNull
                  java.util.List<?> initialKeys)
        Setup creates the Backstack with the specified initial keys.
        Parameters:
        initialKeys - the initial keys of the backstack

      • getBackstack

        public Backstack getBackstack()
        Gets the managed Backstack. It can only be called after setup(List).
        Returns:
        the backstack

      • setStateChanger

        public void setStateChanger(@Nullable
                            StateChanger stateChanger)
        Sets the StateChanger for the given Backstack. This can only be called after setup(List).
        Parameters:
        stateChanger - the state changer

      • detachStateChanger

        public void detachStateChanger()
        Detaches the StateChanger from the Backstack. This can only be called after setup(List).

      • reattachStateChanger

        public void reattachStateChanger()
        Reattaches the StateChanger to the Backstack. This can only be called after setup(List).

      • getSavedState

        @NonNull
public SavedState getSavedState(@NonNull
                                          java.lang.Object key)
        Returns a SavedState instance for the given key. If the state does not exist, then a new associated state is created.
        Parameters:
        key - The key to which the SavedState belongs.
        Returns:
        the saved state that belongs to the given key.

      • persistViewToState

        public void persistViewToState(@Nullable
                               android.view.View view)
        Provides the means to save the provided view's hierarchy state and its optional StateBundle via Bundleable into a SavedState.
        Parameters:
        view - the view that belongs to a certain key

      • restoreViewFromState

        public void restoreViewFromState(@NonNull
                                 android.view.View view)
        Restores the state of the view based on the currently stored SavedState, according to the view's key.
        Parameters:
        view - the view that belongs to a certain key

      • fromBundle

        public void fromBundle(@Nullable
                       StateBundle stateBundle)
        Restores the BackstackManager from a StateBundle. This can only be called after setup(List).
        Specified by:
        fromBundle in interface Bundleable
        Parameters:
        stateBundle - the state bundle obtained via toBundle()

      • toBundle

        @NonNull
public StateBundle toBundle()
        Persists the backstack history and view state into a StateBundle.
        Specified by:
        toBundle in interface Bundleable
        Returns:
        the state bundle
